channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12831] Changing the set of vis labels a user has access to doesn't generate an audit log event
item.description:
Right now, the AccessController makes sure that (when users care about audit events) we generate an audit log event for any access change, like granting or removing a permission from a user.

When the set of labels a user has access to is altered, it gets handled by the VisibilityLabelService and we don't log anything to the audit log.
item.summary: Changing the set of vis labels a user has access to doesn't generate an audit log event

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: You plan to give a patch Sean?
If someone else has time to come up with a patch I'd be happy to review. Little to buried ATM to make one myself.
Patch for master branch. Please review.

This message is automatically generated.

Can we make this more like the AccessController's audit logging, f.e.:


      AUDITLOG.trace("Access " + (result.isAllowed() ? "allowed" : "denied") +

          " for user " + (result.getUser() != null ? result.getUser().getShortName() : "UNKNOWN") +

          "; reason: " + result.getReason() +

          "; remote address: " + (remoteAddr != null ? remoteAddr : "") +

          "; request: " + result.getRequest() +

          "; context: " + result.toContextString());

Then the same regex or parser can be used for both, and both the AC and VC will emit the same information on client and context.

List<String> labelsStr = new ArrayList<String>(visLabels.size());

...

labelsStr.add(Bytes.toString(label));

...

if (AUDITLOG.isTraceEnabled()) {

  AUDITLOG.trace("Add labels: " + labelsStr);

}

Have labels in a List<byte[]> Do the string conversion only within if block.. Similarly other places too.


if (AUDITLOG.isTraceEnabled()) {

  // make labelsStr List convertion bytes to string

  AUDITLOG.trace("Add labels: " + labelsStr);

}
+1 on changing byte[] to String in the 'if' block.

Thanks Andrew, Anoop and Ram for the reviews.
I hope v2 patch addresses your comments.
Please review.
Missed log conf file change in v2.

+      } catch (AccessDeniedException e) {

+        logResult(false, "addLabels", e.getMessage(), null, labels, null);

+        LOG.error(e);

+        setExceptionResults(visLabels.size(), e, response);

In places where we're writing to the normal log, please include more of a message than just the exception object.


+      } catch (IOException e) {

+        // TODO Auto-generated catch block

+        e.printStackTrace();

+      }

please log as a WARN.

This message is automatically generated.

+      } catch (IOException e) {

+        LOG.warn("Failed to get active system user.");

+      }

Please include the exception object. I'd prefer if the exception object was in a second debug message, e.g.


+      } catch (IOException e) {

+        LOG.warn("Failed to get active system user.");

+        LOG.debug("details on failure to get active system user.", e);

+      }

Some way of logging the exception for the active user failure aside, overall looks good. +1.

Thanks Sean Busbey for the review.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
Auditing of visibility label administration.

Administrative actions on visibility labels, such as creation of a label or changing the set of labels a user or group may access, are now sent to the audit log. The audit messages should be similar to those already tracked by the access controller.
